comments:
Found using 0319 driver (also seen using 0305)

I added the following to my plugin.xml in my launch configuration type 
definition:
<fileExtension extension="exe" default="false"/> 

When I brought up the preferences->debug->launch configuration types page, I got 
the following exception because it did not recognize the "exe" extension:

I then went to Preferences->Workbench-> File Editors and added the "exe" 
extension.  It cleared up the above problem, but when I tried the page again 
and clicked on "exe" to see the supported launch configurations, I got the 
following exception:

Setting my launch config as the default for the "exe" extension cleared up the 
second part of the problem.  It appears that each extension must have a default, 
which may not always be the case.

Joe, please take a look at this one to determine if we have a low risk fix for 
milestone 4.

Problem (1) was due to not handling editors that weren't in the editor registry.  Now, file 
extensions that don't map to an editor use the image for the default editor.

Problem (2) was 
due to the lack of a default config type for a file extension.

There was also a third problem, 
also due to no default being set.  This occurred when user clicked OK and the defaults were 
saved.

Fixes made in debug-milestone-4 branch & in HEAD stream.
